intro: Alepidea longifolia subsp. swynnertonii, commonly known as the Swynnerton's lomatia, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and distinctive inflorescences. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in cylindrical spikes, often giving it a striking appearance. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
